go_data.justification: IRF3 causes the transcriptional activation of promoters containing appropriate binding sites.
IRF3 translocates to the nucleus after phosphorylation by TBK1 and IKKepsilon.
IRF-7 is the master regulator of type-I interferon-dependent immune responses.
Virus-dependent phosphorylation of the IRF-3 transcription factor regulates nuclear translocation.
IRF3 binds to appropriate binding sites, such as the IFN-beta and CCL5 promoters, and a subset of promoters containing IFN-stimulated response elements (ISREs).
